name: market for pig iron | pig iron | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/23584/documentation

This is a market activity. Each market represents the consumption mix of a product in a given geography, connecting suppliers with consumers of the same product in the same geographical area. Markets group the producers and also the imports of the product (if relevant) within the same geographical area. They also account for transport to the consumer and for the losses during that process, when relevant.;This is the market for  'pig iron', in the geography of Europe.;This activity represents the supply of pig iron (hot metal) to steelmaking plants in Europe.;Transport distances are based on the ecoinvent "Default Transport Assumptions" model, accessible on the ecoinvent website.

At the gate of the blast furnace plant.

At the gate of the steelmaking plant.
category: C:Manufacturing/24:Manufacture of basic metals/241:Manufacture of basic iron and steel/2410:Manufacture of basic iron and steel

processDocumentation.geographyDescription: Activity represents the supply of iron ore concentrate in Europe.

exchanges.description: Transport distance based on eurostat transport statistics for railway transport of goods. The transport data was extracted from the database leaf "Railway transport - goods transported, by group of goods - from 2008 onwards based on NST 2007 (1 000 t, million tkm) (rail_go_grpgood)" (http://ec.europa.eu/eurostat/data/database) on the 2018-06-01. The transport distance was calculated based on the total mass of goods transported and total payload-distance for the NST 2007 category "GT10 - Basic metals; fabricated metal products, except machinery and equipment" in the year 2016 for all countries for which data was available. The average distance of railway transport for goods in this category in 2016 was 255 km. The fraction of goods transported by rail (in terms of mass) relative to the total mass of goods transported by road, rail and inland waterways was 21.5% in 2016. Therefore, the average distance that goods travelled by rail in 2016 was 55 km. This value is assumed to be representative for Europe.

exchanges.description: Transport distance based on eurostat transport statistics for road freight transport. The transport data was extracted from the database leaf "Annual road freight transport, by type of goods and type of transport (1 000 t, Mio Tkm), from 2008 onwards (road_go_ta_tg)" (http://ec.europa.eu/eurostat/data/database) on the 2018-06-01. The transport distance was calculated based on the total mass of goods transported and total payload-distance for the NST 2007 category "GT10 - Basic metals; fabricated metal products, except machinery and equipment" in the year 2016 for all countries for which data was available. The average distance of road transport for goods in this category in 2016 was 223 km. The fraction of goods transported by road (in terms of mass) relative to the total mass of goods transported by road, rail and inland waterways was 75.5% in 2016. Therefore, the average distance that goods travelled by road in 2016 was 168 km. This value is assumed to be representative for Europe.

exchanges.description: Transport distance based on eurostat transport statistics for transport of goods by inland waterways. The transport data was extracted from the database leaf "Transport by type of good (from 2007 onwards with NST2007) (iww_go_atygo)" (http://ec.europa.eu/eurostat/data/database) on the 2018-06-01. The transport distance was calculated based on the total mass of goods transported and total payload-distance for the NST 2007 category "GT10 - Basic metals; fabricated metal products, except machinery and equipment" in the year 2016 for the European Union (current composition). The average distance of transport by inland waterways for goods in this category in 2016 was 425 km. The fraction of goods transported by inland waterways (in terms of mass) relative to the total mass of goods transported by road, rail and inland waterways was 3.0% in 2016. Therefore, the average distance that goods travelled by inland waterways in 2016 was 13 km. This value is assumed to be representative for Europe.
